node.doctext:
Contents of lib

Standard Pragmata

[perlman:lib:attrs|attrs]
set/get attributes of a subroutine
[perlman:lib:autouse|autouse]
postpone load of modules until a function is used
[perlman:lib:base|base]
Establish
[perlman:lib:blib|blib]
Use MakeMaker's uninstalled version of a package
[perlman:lib:constant|constant]
Perl pragma to declare constants
[perlman:lib:diagnostics|diagnostics]
Perl compiler pragma to force verbose warning diagnostics
[perlman:lib:fields|fields]
compile-time class fields

[perlman:lib:integer|integer]
Perl pragma to compute arithmetic in integer instead of double
[perlman:lib:less|less]
perl pragma to request less of something from the compiler
[perlman:lib:locale|locale]
Perl pragma to use and avoid
[perlman:lib:ops|ops]
Perl pragma to restrict unsafe operations when compiling
[perlman:lib:overload|overload]
Package for overloading perl operations
[perlman:lib:re|re]
Perl pragma to alter regular expression behaviour
[perlman:lib:sigtrap|sigtrap]
Perl pragma to enable simple signal handling
[perlman:lib:strict|strict]
Perl pragma to restrict unsafe constructs
[perlman:lib:subs|subs]
Perl pragma to predeclare sub names
[perlman:lib:vars|vars]
Perl pragma to predeclare global variable names

Standard Modules

[perlman:lib:AnyDBM_File|AnyDBM_File]
provide framework for multiple DBMs
[perlman:lib:AutoLoader|AutoLoader]
load subroutines only on demand
[perlman:lib:AutoSplit|AutoSplit]
split a package for autoloading
[perlman:lib:B|B]
The module used for perlcc, the Perl compiler.
[perlman:B::Asmdata|B::Asmdata]
Autogenerated data about Perl ops, used to generate bytecode
[perlman:B::Assembler|B::Assembler]
Assemble Perl bytecode
[perlman:B::Bblock|B::Bblock]
Walk basic blocks
[perlman:B::Bytecode|B::Bytecode]
Perl compiler's bytecode backend
[perlman:B::C|B::C]
Perl compiler's C backend
[perlman:B::CC|B::CC]
Perl compiler's optimized C translation backend
[perlman:B::Debug|B::Debug]
Walk Perl syntax tree, printing debug info about ops
[perlman:B::Deparse|B::Deparse]
Perl compiler backend to produce perl code
[perlman:B::Disassembler|B::Disassembler]
Disassemble Perl bytecode
[perlman:B::Lint|B::Lint]
Perl lint
[perlman:B::Showlex|B::Showlex]
Show lexical variables used in functions or files
[perlman:B::Stackobj|B::Stackobj]
Helper module for CC backend
[perlman:B::Terse|B::Terse]
Walk Perl syntax tree, printing terse info about ops
[perlman:B::Xref|B::Xref]
Generates cross reference reports for Perl programs
[perlman:lib:Benchmark|Benchmark]
benchmark running times of code
[perlman:lib:Carp|Carp]
warn of errors (from perspective of caller)
[perlman:lib:CGI|CGI]
Simple Common Gateway Interface Class
[perlman:CGI::Apache|CGI::Apache]
Make things work with CGI.pm against Perl-Apache API
[perlman:CGI::Carp|CGI::Carp]
CGI routines for writing to the HTTPD (or other) error log
[perlman:CGI::Cookie|CGI::Cookie]
Interface to Netscape Cookies
[perlman:CGI::Fast|CGI::Fast]
CGI Interface for Fast CGI
[perlman:CGI::Push|CGI::Push]
Simple Interface to Server Push
[perlman:CGI::Switch|CGI::Switch]
Try more than one constructors and return the first object available
[perlman:lib:CPAN|CPAN]
query, download and build perl modules from CPAN sites
[perlman:CPAN::FirstTime|CPAN::FirstTime]
Utility for CPAN::Config file Initialization
[perlman:CPAN::Nox|CPAN::Nox]
Wrapper around CPAN.pm without using any XS module
[perlman:Class::Struct|Class::Struct]
declare struct-like datatypes as Perl classes
[perlman:lib:Config|Config]
access Perl configuration information
[perlman:lib:Cwd|Cwd]
get pathname of current working directory
[perlman:lib:DB_File|DB_File]
Perl5 access to Berkeley DB version 1.x
[perlman:Data::Dumper|Data::Dumper]
stringified perl data structures, suitable for both printing and eval
[perlman:Devel::SelfStubber|Devel::SelfStubber]
generate stubs for a SelfLoading module
[perlman:lib:DirHandle|DirHandle]
supply object methods for directory handles
[perlman:lib:DynaLoader|DynaLoader]
Dynamically load C libraries into Perl code
[perlman:lib:English|English]
use nice English (or awk) names for ugly punctuation variables
[perlman:lib:Env|Env]
perl module that imports environment variables
[perlman:lib:Errno|Errno]
System errno constants
[perlman:lib:Exporter|Exporter]
Implements default import method for modules
ExtUtils
[perlman:ExtUtils::Command|ExtUtils::Command]
utilities to replace common UNIX commands in Makefiles etc.
[perlman:ExtUtils::Embed|ExtUtils::Embed]
Utilities for embedding Perl in C/C++ applications
[perlman:ExtUtils::Install|ExtUtils::Install]
install files from here to there
[perlman:ExtUtils::Installed|ExtUtils::Installed]
Inventory management of installed modules
[perlman:ExtUtils::Liblist|ExtUtils::Liblist]
determine libraries to use and how to use them
[perlman:ExtUtils::MM_OS2|ExtUtils::MM_OS2]
methods to override UN*X behaviour in ExtUtils::MakeMaker
[perlman:ExtUtils::MM_Unix|ExtUtils::MM_Unix]
methods used by ExtUtils::MakeMaker
[perlman:ExtUtils::MM_VMS|ExtUtils::MM_VMS]
methods to override UN*X behaviour in ExtUtils::MakeMaker
[perlman:ExtUtils::MM_Win32|ExtUtils::MM_Win32]
methods to override UN*X behaviour in ExtUtils::MakeMaker
[perlman:ExtUtils::MakeMaker|ExtUtils::MakeMaker]
create an extension Makefile
[perlman:ExtUtils::Manifest|ExtUtils::Manifest]
utilities to write and check a MANIFEST file
[perlman:ExtUtils::Miniperl|ExtUtils::Miniperl]
write the C code for perlmain.c
[perlman:ExtUtils::Mkbootstrap|ExtUtils::Mkbootstrap]
make a bootstrap file for use by DynaLoader
[perlman:ExtUtils::Mksymlists|ExtUtils::Mksymlists]
write linker options files for dynamic extension
[perlman:ExtUtils::Packlist|ExtUtils::Packlist]
manage .packlist files
[perlman:ExtUtils::testlib|ExtUtils::testlib]
add blib/* directories to @INC
[perlman:lib:Fatal|Fatal]
replace functions with equivalents which succeed or die
[perlman:lib:Fcntl|Fcntl]
load the C Fcntl.h defines
File
[perlman:File::Basename|File::Basename]
split a pathname into pieces
[perlman:File::CheckTree|File::CheckTree]
run many filetest checks on a tree
[perlman:File::Compare|File::Compare]
Compare files or filehandles
[perlman:File::Copy|File::Copy]
Copy files or filehandles
[perlman:File::DosGlob|File::DosGlob]
DOS like globbing and then some
[perlman:File::Find|File::Find]
traverse a file tree
[perlman:File::Path|File::Path]
create or remove a series of directories
File::Spec
portably perform operations on file names
[perlman:File::Spec/Mac|File::Spec/Mac]
File::Spec for MacOS
[perlman:File::Spec/OS2|File::Spec/OS2]
methods for OS/2 file specs
[perlman:File::Spec/Unix|File::Spec/Unix]
methods used by File::Spec
[perlman:File::Spec/VMS|File::Spec/VMS]
methods for VMS file specs
[perlman:File::Spec/Win32|File::Spec/Win32]
methods for Win32 file specs
[perlman:File::Spec|File::Spec]
portably perform operations on file names
[perlman:File::stat|File::stat]
by-name interface to Perl's built-in stat() functions
[perlman:lib:FileCache|FileCache]
keep more files open than the system permits
[perlman:lib:FileHandle|FileHandle]
supply object methods for filehandles
[perlman:lib:FindBin|FindBin]
Locate directory of original perl script
[perlman:lib:GDBM_File|GDBM_File]
Perl5 access to the gdbm library.
Getopt
[perlman:Getopt::Long|Getopt::Long]
extended processing of command line options
[perlman:Getopt::Std|Getopt::Std]
Process single-character switches with switch clustering
[perlman:Dumper::Changes|Dumper::Changes]
public release history for Data::Dumper
[perlman:I18N::Collate|I18N::Collate]
compare 8-bit scalar data according to the current locale
[perlman:lib:IO|IO]
load various IO modules
[perlman:IO::File|IO::File]
supply object methods for filehandles
[perlman:IO::Handle|IO::Handle]
supply object methods for I/O handles
[perlman:IO::Seekable|IO::Seekable]
supply seek based methods for I/O objects
[perlman:IO::Select|IO::Select]
OO interface to the select system call
[perlman:IO::Socket|IO::Socket]
Object interface to socket communications
[perlman:IO::Pipe|IO::Pipe]
supply object methods for pipes
IPC
[perlman:IPC::Msg|IPC::Msg]
SysV Msg IPC object class
[perlman:IPC::Open2|IPC::Open2]
open a process for both reading and writing
[perlman:IPC::Open3|IPC::Open3]
open a process for reading, writing, and error handling
[perlman:IPC::Semaphore|IPC::Semaphore]
SysV Semaphore IPC object class
[perlman:IPC::SysV|IPC::SysV]
SysV IPC constants
Math
[perlman:Math::BigFloat|Math::BigFloat]
Arbitrary length float math package
[perlman:Math::BigInt|Math::BigInt]
Arbitrary size integer math package
[perlman:Math::Complex|Math::Complex]
complex numbers and associated mathematical functions
[perlman:Math::Trig|Math::Trig]
trigonometric functions
[perlman:lib:NDBM_File|NDBM_File]
Tied access to ndbm files
Net
[perlman:Net::Ping|Net::Ping]
check a remote host for reachability
[perlman:Net::hostent|Net::hostent]
by-name interface to Perl's built-in gethost*() functions
[perlman:Net::netent|Net::netent]
by-name interface to Perl's built-in getnet*() functions
[perlman:Net::protoent|Net::protoent]
by-name interface to Perl's built-in getproto*() functions
[perlman:Net::servent|Net::servent]
by-name interface to Perl's built-in getserv*() functions
[perlman:lib:O|O]
Generic interface to Perl Compiler backends
[perlman:lib:ODBM_File|ODBM_File]
Tied access to odbm files
[perlman:lib:Opcode|Opcode]
Disable named opcodes when compiling perl code
[perlman:lib:POSIX|POSIX]
Perl interface to IEEE Std 1003.1
Pod
[perlman:Pod::Html|Pod::Html]
module to convert pod files to HTML
[perlman:Pod::Text|Pod::Text]
convert POD data to formatted ASCII text
[perlman:lib:SDBM_File|SDBM_File]
Tied access to sdbm files
[perlman:lib:Safe|Safe]
Compile and execute code in restricted compartments
[perlman:Search::Dict|Search::Dict]
search for key in dictionary file
[perlman:lib:SelectSaver|SelectSaver]
save and restore selected file handle
[perlman:lib:SelfLoader|SelfLoader]
load functions only on demand
[perlman:lib:Shell|Shell]
run shell commands transparently within perl
[perlman:lib:Socket|Socket]
load the C socket.h defines and structure manipulators
[perlman:lib:Symbol|Symbol]
manipulate Perl symbols and their names
Sys
[perlman:Sys::Hostname|Sys::Hostname]
Try every conceivable way to get hostname
[perlman:Sys::Syslog|Sys::Syslog]
Perl interface to the UNIX syslog(3) calls
Term
[perlman:Term::Cap|Term::Cap]
Perl termcap interface
[perlman:Term::Complete|Term::Complete]
Perl word completion module
[perlman:Term::ReadLine|Term::ReadLine]
Perl interface to various readline packages. If no real package is found, substitutes stubs instead of basic functions.
[perlman:lib:Test|Test]
provides a simple framework for writing test scripts
[perlman:Test::Harness|Test::Harness]
run perl standard test scripts with statistics
Text
[perlman:Text::Abbrev|Text::Abbrev]
create an abbreviation table from a list
[perlman:Text::ParseWords|Text::ParseWords]
parse text into an array of tokens or array of arrays
[perlman:Text::Soundex|Text::Soundex]
Implementation of the Soundex Algorithm as Described by Knuth
[perlman:Text::Tabs|Text::Tabs]
expand and unexpand tabs per the unix expand(1) and unexpand(1)
[perlman:Text::Wrap|Text::Wrap]
line wrapping to form simple paragraphs
[perlman:lib:Thread|Thread]
multithreading
[perlman:Thread::Queue|Thread::Queue]
thread-safe queues
[perlman:Thread::Semaphore|Thread::Semaphore]
thread-safe semaphores
[perlman:Thread::Signal|Thread::Signal]
Start a thread which runs signal handlers reliably
[perlman:Thread::Specific|Thread::Specific]
thread-specific keys
Tie
[perlman:Tie::Array|Tie::Array]
base class for tied arrays
[perlman:Tie::Handle|Tie::Handle]
base class definitions for tied handles
[perlman:Tie::Hash|Tie::Hash]
base class definitions for tied hashes
[perlman:Tie::RefHash|Tie::RefHash]
use references as hash keys
[perlman:Tie::Scalar|Tie::Scalar]
base class definitions for tied scalars
[perlman:Tie::SubstrHash|Tie::SubstrHash]
Fixed-table-size, fixed-key-length hashing
Time
[perlman:Time::Local|Time::Local]
efficiently compute time from local and GMT time
[perlman:Time::gmtime|Time::gmtime]
by-name interface to Perl's built-in gmtime() function
[perlman:Time::localtime|Time::localtime]
by-name interface to Perl's built-in localtime() function
[perlman:Time::tm|Time::tm]
internal object used by Time::gmtime and Time::localtime
[perlman:lib:UNIVERSAL|UNIVERSAL]
base class for ALL classes (blessed references)
User
[perlman:User::grent|User::grent]
by-name interface to Perl's built-in getgr*() functions
[perlman:User::pwent|User::pwent]
by-name interface to Perl's built-in getpw*() functions
node.title: perlman:lib:index
